instructions: Open Settings from the home screen or app drawer. Scroll down to the bottom of the page. Tap System . How to restore your apps and settings to a new Android phone Source: Android Central Select Backup . Ensure the Back up to Google Drive toggle is selected. You'll be able to see the data that is being backed up. How to restore your apps and settings to a new Android phone Source: Android Central

Select the language and hit the Let's Go button at the welcome screen. Tap Copy your data to use the restore option. Connect to a Wi-Fi network to get started. How to restore your apps and settings to a new Android phone Source: Android Central At the next screen, you'll see all the restore options available. Select A backup from an Android phone if you have your old phone handy. In this instance, we'll go with the A backup from the cloud option. Sign in to your Google account (if you haven't already, set up two-factor authentication ). Select I agree to Google's Terms of Service to proceed. How to restore your apps and settings to a new Android phone Source: Android Central You'll see a list of backup options . Select the relevant one to restore data. Hit Restore if you want all the data and settings from your previous device restored. Hit Apps to choose what apps to install on your new device. How to restore your apps and settings to a new Android phone Source: Android Central Your data will be restored in the background. In the meantime, you can set up a screen lock and biometric authentication . Hit Set up screen lock to get started. Choose a mode of screen unlock and add your fingerprint. How to restore your apps and settings to a new Android phone Source: Android Central You can set up Google Assistant after you're done registering your fingerprints. Select Get Started to use Voice Match. Train Assistant to recognize your voice and hit Done to finish. How to restore your apps and settings to a new Android phone Source: Android Central
